sections.name: Poison
sections.text: The xacarba can choose between three poisions.  The save DC of each is Constitution-based. Bite:

sections.name: Fiendish Bile
sections.effect: 1d4 Strength damage (good-aligned creatures also take 2d8 points of damage).

sections.name: Mysterious Blood
sections.effect: 1d4 Dex and 1d4 Wis damage plus confusion for 1 round.

sections.name: Vile Disjunction
sections.effect: Targeted greater dispel magic (CL 18th) on the creature.

sections.name: Redirect Spell
sections.text: Any creature that attempts to cast a spell within 30 feet of a xacarba must cast the spell defensively. If the caster fails the concentration check to do so (or if the caster opts to not cast defensively), the xacarba can choose the target of the spell as a immediate action. The new target must be a legal target—if there's no legal alternative target to choose from, this ability cannot be used.

Fiends hailing from the darkest reaches of the Abyss, xacarbas are manipulation and destruction intertwined. With their infamous ability to redirect spells, these serpentine goliaths wreak havoc on the mind as well as the body, turning allies against one another and reveling in the destruction doing so produces.
